name: Biceps Brachii (Short Head)
description: Inner part of the upper arm muscle; involved in bending the elbow (flexion) and rotating the forearm palm-up (supination).

name: Biceps Brachii (Long Head)
description: Outer part of the upper arm muscle; helps bend the elbow (flexion) and raise the arm forward (shoulder flexion).

name: Brachialis
description: Located underneath the biceps in the upper arm; a primary mover for bending the elbow (flexion).

name: Anterior Deltoid
description: Front section of the shoulder; responsible for lifting the arm forward (shoulder flexion) and horizontal adduction.

name: Lateral Deltoid
description: Side section of the shoulder; responsible for lifting the arm out to the side (shoulder abduction).

name: Posterior Deltoid
description: Rear section of the shoulder; responsible for pulling the arm backward (horizontal extension) and external rotation.

name: Triceps Brachii (Long Head)
description: Largest part of the triceps, on the back of the upper arm; straightens the elbow (extension) and helps pull the arm back.

name: Triceps Brachii (Lateral Head)
description: Outer part of the triceps on the back of the upper arm; straightens the elbow (extension).

name: Triceps Brachii (Medial Head)
description: Located deep on the back of the upper arm; straightens the elbow (extension).

name: Pectoralis Major (Clavicular Head)
description: The upper portion of the chest; involved in lifting the arm forward and across the body (e.g., incline press).

name: Pectoralis Major (Sternal Head)
description: The large, fan-shaped mid and lower portion of the chest; brings the arm across the body (horizontal adduction) and down (e.g., bench press, dips).

name: Pectoralis Minor
description: Small muscle located deep to the Pectoralis Major; helps pull the shoulder blade forward and down (protraction).

name: Latissimus Dorsi
description: Large V-shaped muscle on the back; responsible for pulling motions (e.g., pull-ups, rows) by bringing the arm down and back.

name: Trapezius (Upper)
description: Top part of the trapezius (neck to shoulders); primarily used for shrugging the shoulders up (elevation).

name: Trapezius (Middle)
description: Middle part of the trapezius, between the shoulder blades; pulls the shoulder blades together (retraction).

name: Trapezius (Lower)
description: Lower part of the trapezius in the mid-back; pulls the shoulder blades down (depression).

name: Rhomboids
description: Located deep to the traps, between the shoulder blades; work with the mid-traps to pull the shoulder blades together (retraction).

name: Erector Spinae
description: A group of muscles running along the spine; responsible for extending (straightening/bending back) the back.

name: Teres Major
description: Located on the upper, outer back near the armpit; assists the lats in pulling the arm down and back (adduction/extension).

name: Rectus Femoris
description: Central muscle of the quadriceps (front thigh); straightens the knee (extension) and flexes the hip.

name: Vastus Lateralis
description: Outer muscle of the quadriceps (front thigh); straightens the knee (extension).

name: Vastus Medialis
description: Inner muscle of the quadriceps (front thigh), 'teardrop' shaped near the knee; straightens the knee (extension).

name: Vastus Intermedius
description: Located deep in the quadriceps, beneath the Rectus Femoris; straightens the knee (extension).

name: Biceps Femoris
description: Outer muscle of the hamstring (back of thigh); bends the knee (flexion) and extends the hip.

name: Semitendinosus
description: One of the inner muscles of the hamstring (back of thigh); bends the knee (flexion) and extends the hip.

name: Semimembranosus
description: The other inner muscle of the hamstring (back of thigh); bends the knee (flexion) and extends the hip.

name: Gluteus Maximus
description: The largest muscle of the buttocks; powerful hip extender (e.g., standing up from a squat, thrusting).

name: Gluteus Medius
description: Located on the upper, outer side of the buttocks; moves the leg sideways (abduction) and stabilizes the pelvis.

name: Gluteus Minimus
description: Located deep to the Gluteus Medius; assists in moving the leg sideways (abduction) and stabilizing the pelvis.

name: Gastrocnemius
description: The larger, upper muscle of the calf; responsible for pointing the toes (plantarflexion), especially with a straight knee.

name: Soleus
description: Located underneath the Gastrocnemius in the calf; responsible for pointing the toes (plantarflexion), especially with a bent knee.

name: Rectus Abdominis
description: Front abdominal muscles ('six-pack'); responsible for bending the spine forward (flexion, e.g., crunches).

name: Transverse Abdominis
description: Deepest abdominal muscle, acts like a corset; stabilizes the spine and compresses the abdomen (bracing).

name: Forearm Flexors
description: Muscles on the underside (palm side) of the forearm; responsible for bending the wrist (flexion) and gripping.

name: Forearm Extensors
description: Muscles on the top (knuckle side) of the forearm; responsible for extending the wrist backward (extension).

name: Brachioradialis
description: Large muscle on the thumb-side of the forearm; assists in bending the elbow (flexion), especially with a neutral grip.

name: External Obliques
description: Outer layer of muscles on the sides of the abdomen; involved in twisting the torso (rotation) and bending sideways (lateral flexion).

name: Internal Obliques
description: Located deep to the External Obliques; assist in twisting the torso (rotation) and bending sideways (lateral flexion).

name: Adductor Magnus
description: Largest muscle of the inner thigh; pulls the leg toward the body's midline (adduction) and assists in hip extension.

name: Adductor Longus
description: Located in the upper, inner thigh; pulls the leg toward the body's midline (adduction).

name: Adductor Brevis
description: Located deep in the upper, inner thigh; pulls the leg toward the body's midline (adduction).

name: Pectineus
description: Located at the top of the inner thigh (groin); pulls the leg in (adduction) and helps lift the knee (flexion).

name: Gracilis
description: A long, thin muscle running along the inner thigh; pulls the leg in (adduction) and assists in bending the knee.

name: Tensor Fasciae Latae (TFL)
description: Small muscle on the outside of the hip (near your pocket); moves the leg sideways (abduction) and forward (flexion).

name: Iliopsoas
description: Deep hip flexor muscles connecting the spine to the thigh bone; primary muscle for lifting the knee (hip flexion).

name: Sartorius
description: Longest muscle in the body, crossing the front of the thigh; helps lift the knee and rotate the leg (e.g., sitting cross-legged).

name: Supraspinatus
description: Rotator cuff muscle located on top of the shoulder blade; helps initiate lifting the arm to the side (abduction).

name: Infraspinatus
description: Rotator cuff muscle on the back of the shoulder blade; primary mover for rotating the arm outward (external rotation).

name: Teres Minor
description: Small rotator cuff muscle below the Infraspinatus; assists in rotating the arm outward (external rotation).

name: Subscapularis
description: Rotator cuff muscle on the front (underside) of the shoulder blade; primary mover for rotating the arm inward (internal rotation).

name: Sternocleidomastoid
description: Large muscle on the side of the neck; turns the head (rotation) and flexes the neck forward.

name: Levator Scapulae
description: Muscle running from the neck to the shoulder blade; helps lift the shoulder blade (shrug) and bend the neck sideways.

name: Splenius
description: Muscles on the back of the neck; responsible for tilting the head backward (extension) and turning the head.

name: Serratus Anterior
description: Located on the side of the ribs ('boxer's muscle'); pulls the shoulder blade forward (protraction, e.g., punching motion).

name: Tibialis Anterior
description: Muscle on the front of the shin; responsible for pulling the foot and toes upward (dorsiflexion).

name: Pronator Teres
description: Located in the upper forearm; primary muscle for rotating the forearm so the palm faces down (pronation).

name: Supinator
description: Located deep in the upper forearm; primary muscle for rotating the forearm so the palm faces up (supination).
